The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Omalotheca pichleri is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
